title: DinoDoggie
text: I LOVE that we are able to design our own Dino shirts for our dogs!!! I just opened the one I ordered. Gorgeous!!!! The colors are much more vibrant than my phone displayed. This is an Easter gift for my grand pup. The Kelly green is going to be beautiful against his boxer brown coat. I could not be more happy with the quality of The Plus Size Pooch!!! I‚Äôm thrilled that my large dogs can be just a cute as the purse size pooches. I‚Äôve also found that when my dogs are ‚Äúdressed up‚Äù most people are less afraid of them. Big dogs are not necessarily vicious and being cute has never hurt a dog except maybe around their waist line.üòÇ

title: First time ordering
text: I stumbled across this online store by pure chance and I‚Äôm happy I did!! The prices are great and variety also‚Ä¶ I placed my order on Thursday night and received my package today Monday!!! Customer service is good I ordered something that they didn‚Äôt have in stock at the moment and I received a email with 20 minutes of ordering asking if I wanted to replace it or just refund the one item‚Ä¶ Everything came in their original packing and work great I will definitely be ordering from here now on I‚Äôm paying close to $10 less than what I pay buying in person!!!

title: Jumped off the bandwagon‚Ä¶ had to get back on
text: I was taking these supplements for over 5 yrs‚Ä¶ my hair hit a plateau so I decided to try another brand. The other brand definitely worked and so does Hairfinity‚Ä¶. Change is good! However the other brand stopped having the supply, hence I had to go back to the OG I started off with! My order was placed on Wednesday I received it on FRIDAY‚Ä¶ now that‚Äôs service. It‚Äôs only been almost 2 weeks since I‚Äôve been back on them so we shall see. I must say my energy level is insane since back on them! THANK YOU & keep up the great work you do. Much appreciative‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Why any other chocolate?
text:
Great chocolate! Every type has the same rich, melodic taste of beauty, calmness and a touch of naughty thrill.

The owners!  I don‚Äôt know both brothers as well but ADAM, what a guy. Not only does he help produce and make it, he also puts his smile up front in the shop for all to see. His knowledge, calm demeanor, quick and infectious humor and laughter and amazing kindness as well as high praise of his workers is genuine and pleasurable to hear.

Buying chocolate in the shop is fun. Buying on line isn‚Äôt as fun and the postage hurts but knowing I am supporting a high quality product that is supporting good families here and in Peru. Can it get better?

title: please do not use this app
text: god forbid you need any assistance or help doing anything. they have no phone number, they have no email, after you spend about half an hour trying to find even a crumb of customer support they will send you into a chat room that will take another half hour to get into, just to have no answers or help for anything regarding your situation. oh my god, i have seriously never had this much of an issue with customer service in my life. i dont even think i have written a bad review on the appstore yet and ive been using it since the very first iphone came out. this app‚Äôs customer service needs serious, SERIOUS help. i genuinely wish anyone trying to get help for their situation the absolute best of luck and i hope no one has to go through everything i have just to end up nowhere.

title: Fails at the one thing it‚Äôs supposed to do.
text: Currently tracking 12 deliveries and it has no idea that half of them were delivered, some were delivered days ago. Refreshing the app doesn‚Äôt seem to update any of the tracking, if I just simply click through and visit the real tracking sites I can see the complete tracking right there. If I can do that, why can‚Äôt the app. The app has also been tracking two ghost packages that don‚Äôt exist for the past month or so. It only picks up on about half the tracking numbers emailed to me, but when I paste the number into the app it recognizes the correct carrier immediately, so why didn‚Äôt it notice the emails, it is watching my emails after all‚Ä¶ overall it‚Äôs more frustrating than useful.

title: This app is terrible!
text: So first of all, it doesn‚Äôt give you ANY tracking information.  It just says your order was ‚Äúconfirmed‚Äù and when it was ordered (which changes for same strange reason).  Second, when you use the ‚Äúcontact us‚Äù link to speak with a ‚Äúrobot representative‚Äù, it gives vague answers and passes the blame to the shop you brought from (which doesn‚Äôt respond to any questions).  Lastly, you can‚Äôt use any other app to track your order.  You can‚Äôt even use post office/UPS websites as it DOESN‚ÄôT GIVE YOU A TRACKING NUMBER!!!  WT*!  This App is useless, please DON‚ÄôT was the time to use it.

title: Borla Exhaust
text: I ordered & paid for my exhaust on 8/9/21. I still haven‚Äôt received it. I‚Äôve sent emails, texted and have tried to call customer service many times. I can‚Äôt get anyone to give me a response as to when I can expect my order. The only response I have received is ‚Äúwe are checking on your order and will get back with you‚Äù. It‚Äôs been several days since I was sent a text with that response and I‚Äôve yet to hear anything. All I‚Äôm wanting to know is‚Ä¶..if you had to order don‚Äôt you know when your expected to receive it. It‚Äôs says on their website 3-7 business day shipping‚Ä¶.obviously that‚Äôs NOT true. I asked if I just needed to request a refund but got no response to that either. I‚Äôm very disappointed with the lack of communication from this company. Especially with an over $1,200 order!!!!!

title: WAS great until the rename and redesign!
text: This app was one of my favorites for tracking orders from multiple emails, HOWEVER, they recently decided to rename and redesign a perfectly functioning app and make it not-so-functional anymore. They took away the left swipe auto-archive feature, which, when you have tens or hundreds of packages to track, is a time saving feature. Now you NOT ONLY have to open each order individually, but theres not even a quick ‚Äúarchive order‚Äù button, no, you need to click a setting button and then select ‚Äúarchive order‚Äù or ‚Äúdelete.‚Äù A three step process, for EACH package, when it used to be one swipe!? Forget to do it for a week and you'll spend a half hour clearing your dashboard. Completely useless. Also struggled with ‚Äúfetching‚Äù data from tracking #s you input yourself (like from Paypal invoices). HARD PASS.

title: Not too reliable-
text:
I have been having the app since it was called Arrive. The app is really slow on updating the tracking info. Sometimes it takes a couple of hours to officially update with what‚Äôs going on with the vehicle. I know this because I am someone who is constantly checking the tracking info once I have ordered something and unfortunately this app doesn‚Äôt update immediately to show me where my package is at so I have no choice but to use the actual carrier website that is delivering the package. If you ask me, the app is pretty useless if I have to check the carrier website anyways, I might as well do that without the app. 
The one good thing I liked is it shows you all your shipments that are on its way on one screen instead of me searching through my email to find the tracking info for a particular site.

title: New update doesn‚Äôt keep anything simple
text:
I was really loving the Arrive app. I installed the update today that turned it into the Shop app. I liked the simplicity that the Arrive version had, calming shades of blue, no ads, and it kept me off of the ever so tempting websites that I was tracking orders from. 

New Shop version: I can deal with the purple, and I like the goal of offsetting carbon emissions. But I hate the new shopping feature. I just had to manually unfollow all the places I‚Äôve ever bought from that were automatically followed with the update. I already have a problem with impulse shopping, I don‚Äôt need to see more of the shops presence in another app. I miss the old version that really kept things KISS (keep it simple stupid). One app, one purpose.

title: Inaccurate Updates
text: After purchasing product from several companies and seeing Arrive as a way to get real time updates on package deliveries, I thought why not try it? I was very disappointed in the app performance from the first delivery. Arrive‚Äôs notifications about packages are not real time and are often several hours behind. Today was the breaking point when I decided to delete the app. I had a package deliver at 9am (luckily my fianc√©e was home to collect it). At 12pm, Arrive notifies me that the package is out for delivery. At 2:30pm, Arrive notifies me that the package has been delivered. At this point the package has been delivered for 5 hours. If no one had been home, this would have given anyone a large enough window to swipe the package before we even knew it had been delivered. UPS/FedEx/Amazon remain the better option for real time delivery notifications.

title: Actually Not a Pointless App
text: I downloaded this because i wanted better tracking on my jeffree star products, and i‚Äôve actually been able to use it for everything i‚Äôve ordered online which is really nice. I get better updates on my package than I do from some companies. For instance I bought lashes from a instagram account and it took them over a month to send them, but she kept saying they sent out etc idk it was annoying so I just emailed her screenshots from this app. it‚Äôs easy simple, no set up, ur orders just pop up which is soooo nice so u don‚Äôt have to put in any information etc it‚Äôs just in the app already.

title: Not Very Helpful
text: I buy almost everything online these days. I was excited to find this app, hoping it would help me make keep track of whether I have received everything. Unfortunately, the app only found some of the notifications in my emails ‚Äî not even half of them. I can enter the shipment notifications manually, but it‚Äôs tedious, and kind of defeats the purpose. In addition, it could only detect notifications of shipments, not order confirmations. So if I ordered something and it never shipped, it didn‚Äôt appear in the app. Those CAN‚Äôt be entered manually because it requires a shipment number from the carrier to add an entry. Finally, the delivery notifications almost always come hours after the delivery happens. So the app is actually less helpful than the emails I was hoping it would consolidate.

title: The best tracking app, period.
text: So there are a lot of tracking apps out there but Arrive takes the cake. Being made by Shopify, there is nothing to fear if you let them have email access so they can auto scan for packages. Everything gets auto organized and the interface is so clean. I also love how I can quickly see the status of all my packages at a glance. If you are like me and get impatient with your deliveries it even can help you contact the shipping company if you have questions as it has easy to find contact links so you don‚Äôt have to go digging for UPS‚Äô number. This app does everything except sign for you!

title: DELIVERY STATUS

 Thank you.

title: Love this artist (and the birds.)

title: I love that I can know exactly when my order is delivered

title: Lacks

title: Get this app, get your packages!
text:

So expecting packages when shippers insist that USPS is the absolute best in industry was a creep shoot before this app. USPS has their act down, they always act absolutely amazed when packages sprout legs, since they refuse to do their jobs. 

Now however, I can get a tracking number and I m kept informed exactly where my packages are at. I can therefor be in place to receive my packages. I wish I had this app when the local USPS decided to stop doing their jobs. This app is definitely worth it and it would br saved the thousands USPS has cost me over the last few years.

title: Useless

title: Was five stars but now‚Ä¶
text: I‚Äôve used this app for a couple years and really loved it, but recently they‚Äôve added ads/shopping suggestions for shops and products on the home screen. Now you have to go to a separate screen to see all your orders. There‚Äôs also no way, that I know of, to change the ad. When the ads first came out I clicked on one for some underwear and now all I see every time I open the app is the same picture with some dudes junk. I got this app to track my orders not to shop and have products shoved in my face. Unfortunately, as soon as I can find a decent replacement I will delete it, unless the devs change it so I can turn off the shopping suggestions.

title: Shop the app
text: It is a really cool and nifty app it literally puts everything that i have ordered online and lets me know in somewhat real time with some delay depending on how often the shipping company updates the package status but it will always let me know when the package had shipped, awaiting package label created, package will arrive in 7 days, and let me know  if the package is out for delivery. I only use this app when i have ordered a package to track where it is due to how easy it is and it will automatically log itself if i use the corresponding email that i made the account with

title: Glad I found you
text: I was reading an article in the WSJ and introduced to your company. After doing due diligence I was immediately impressed with what you offered. Although many of your items had been exhausted, the site keeps customers informed of current inventory. For example after a few days I checked back and behold a new update on PPE. As a result I was able to order what I needed because of your commitment to the consumer. All in all I am thoroughly satisfied by your A1 customer service and quality product. To this end I have added this website to my favorites.

title: Intuitive and enjoyable shopping app
text:
Shop is great and is naturally intuitive making for an user friendly experience. Shop pay available is a nice feature, don‚Äôt necessarily use it though. 
Linking outside accounts to automatically upload parcel/package tracking have a few connectivity issues. Recently found that updates on packages are prematurely time stamped in my time zone. 

Positives: I enjoy the visual tracking showing geographic locations of my purchases (They seem to be delayed due to delayed carrier updates and I‚Äôm sure COVID exasterbated the supply chain issues -not fault of the shop app). Great feature, you may be surprised by the route your items ship. 

Can follow many of your favorite brands often showing best selling items or sale items which is like electronic window shopping. Kind of fun. 

Delivery celebration is fun! Confetti to celebrate my package delivery is exactly how I feel and makes me happy :) 

My favorite tracking app despite some minor flaws, it‚Äôs always getting better as it‚Äôs tweaked.

title: Not What I Was Expecting
text:
First off, Shop‚Äôs description stated they fixed bugs in the program that prevented users from logging in. Not true. Had to delete and re-download the app several times before it finally allowed me to log in through my Apple account.

Once I got in, I tried to enter my online orders but found that you can only enter and save an entry if the retailer has actually shipped and provided tracking details for the product. This is really frustrating, because I was wanting to log all my confirmed online purchases, regardless of their shipping status.

This is a flawed system intended to organize and track online orders. I was hoping this app provided more availability to track the history of your online purchases, rather than just the actual shipping status. Re-formatting this could vastly improve user experience.

title: Ok, but not perfect
text: When it was arrive, you could swipe either side of the tracking and it would either archive or mark as delivered. I preferred that, it was easier than going in and selecting the 3 dots, then selecting what you want to do with the package. The thing that still bothers me is that ontrac doesn‚Äôt work. Not then, not now. You have to copy the number, select contact, select visit website, and paste to search for your item. It‚Äôs really annoying. And it still is late when tracking your packages. It doesn‚Äôt change for at least 30 minutes. The map is also soooo wrong. Let‚Äôs say an item is shipped from New York to San Francisco. If the item is clearly in San Francisco on route to its destination, it is still showing its route from New York. It‚Äôs all wrong. Please fix these issues.

title: Worst delivery I‚Äôve ever seen!
text: I ordered an item for Valentine‚Äôs Day in February and the site said 7-10 day shipping and I‚Äôve sent 3 emails about status of order and person responding barely speaks English and provides no update on order. title: Really Good And Fresh :)
text:

title: A terrible app
text: I don‚Äôt know how or why people are saying that there information has been accurate using this app. I had to buy 3 things that all required I use this app. They all three said delivered at the same time but none of them had actually showed up. title: Quick, Easy, and efficient

title: Great for Consolidating Delivery Tracking
text: This is a great app with a clean UI for tracking multiple packages at a time and keeps things very organized. My only qualm with it is the delay between this app keeping you up to date by the second and minute versus the couriers. It‚Äôs almost always very delayed when it comes to receiving updates. There hasn‚Äôt been one instance where a package has been delivered and the app showed the item being delivered; it always take up to and hour after. I don‚Äôt know if this is an issue with the app itself or if it‚Äôs on the couriers end but this needs to be fixed or why bother with the app if it doesn‚Äôt keep you informed in a timely manner.

title: SO SO HELPFUL

title: Don‚Äôt buy
text: I ordered three candles. I received two that was shattered. I could not see it in the box. I reached in and cut my hand. I called goose creek and simply asked for two of the same candles to be shipped to me. I was told that is against policy unless I had pictures. Who would think to take pictures when they are pouring blood and on blood thinners? I had children here and asked my husband to take them to the outside trash bin. I asked to speak to a manager and was told that by Looking at my history, that I have never asked for more candles in the past, so all they could do was give me a gift certificate. I was treated as if I busted the candles. I will NEVER buy your candles again and will tell everyone I know to do the same. Always remember, the customer pays your salary at the end of the day and keeps your company running.

title: No question as to where your shipment is at any time!
text: ‚ÄúArrive‚Äù keeps me informed at every point for every delivery I‚Äôm expecting as well as the surprises that my wife or son have ordered. Sometimes I even forget that I have an order, but ‚ÄúArrive‚Äù knows. Between personal and business, we receive many packages and this takes out the guesswork. No more checking the front porch over and over to see if we have a delivery, I just wait for the text, then pick it up and open it or, usually, take it to my wife. I love to see her excitement. It‚Äôs like Christmas every day! It‚Äôs a great app!

title: It‚Äôs okay, still buggy tho
text:
Most of the UX issues I had have been fixed. There is more division between items and there are less clicks needed to get at data. However, now there is a ‚Äúlink your google account‚Äù modal that takes up a third of the screen that won‚Äôt go away, even when the X is clicked.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Previous review:

The designers need to take a page from Material Design or something. The interface is way too flat and busy, and it‚Äôs hard to tell separation of different orders. It‚Äôs also hard to find the information I need from a single order since it is often hidden behind more drilldown menus or in a place that is not immediately obvious. A big reason for the confusing layout is the lack of depth on orders and information blocks, it‚Äôs hard to tell where one ends and the next one starts. Different kinds of orders have completely different layouts as well (Shop Pay orders vs. simple tracking numbers), adding to the confusion.

Also the tracking data is consistently out of date. I always have to click through to the tracker website to get the real time data.

title: Great app....could use work staying up to date
text: Love this app! So awesome to be able to track all your shipments in one place even with multiple email addresses. Also love that you can see exactly what items you order along with a and the map of where it is, as well as the confetti when it‚Äôs delivered. However, I do think the app could use some work in the actual tracking department. It needs to be more up to date. What‚Äôs the point of the app in I‚Äôm still checking the tracking through the carrier website? I also wish it would have a place for delay updates like the mail carrier sites do.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work
text: I‚Äôm confused by all the great reviews of this app. I thought an app from shopify would be great. I connected my gmail account and no orders were automatically connected despite a slew of fedex update emails in my inbox (surely the easiest type of order email to detect). I then force quit the app several times and half my orders showed up. The other half I tried to add manually but couldn‚Äôt. Errors included me adding a tracking number and nothing happening, then it said the order was already being tracked but not showing up in the list. The dumbest feature is when it tells you to tap the order number to copy it to clipboard but it just activates the link to the fedex website ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è and doesn‚Äôt copy the order number. There‚Äôs no way to sort your orders either by date or shop as far as I can see. Complete waste of time.

title: Super Easy and Cool Tool
text: I love the fact that this app automatically get your deliveries information from your Google email. The only bad thing is that use only Gmail to get the information. If you have another email like outlook or any other email this app would not work automatically. You will need to add the tracking number for your company (UPS, USPS or FedEx) manually and then all the tracking will be automatically from there. Is not a problem for me because I use Gmail for my delivery information from all the companies. I still think that this app is the best mail or package delivery tracking app I have tried.

title: Huge privacy concern.
text:
How are people okay with allowing this service to read all their emails? I don't get it...  They say they don't sell your info, ok, great.  They still have access to all your emails and personal information to do with as they please. Imagine some random person on the street reading your emails. Forget that!

Edit 7/3/18
Made a new email account just for the service and I set a forwarding rule.  Works flawlessly actually.  I still get text messages for tracking updates(another service, not this app) but it's nice to have all my orders in one place so I can quickly see the status of all my deliveries.
